alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 11:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Whitley County through 1245 AM EDT... At 1152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goldbug, or over Williamsburg, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Goldbug, Clio and Youngs Creek around 1205 AM EDT. Wofford and Suttons Mill around 1210 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Walden, Deering, Rockholds, Faber, Rye and Woodbine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
